entries.title: Proud to be going strong by your side!
entries.text: Closing thoughts on hosting YAPC::EU, from Amalia.
entries.author: amalia_pomian

entries.title: backseat YAPC::EU
entries.text: This year Lichtkind didn't speak at YAPC::EU, he just attended. And he enjoyed it.
entries.author: herbert_breunung

entries.text: Dave's thoughts on this year's YAPC::EU.
entries.author: dave_cross
entries.title: Dave Cross's report on YAPC::EU

entries.text: Thomas's report on the firsy Alpine Perl Workshop.
entries.author: thomas_klausner
entries.title: Alpine Perl Workshop 2016

entries.text: Miguel Prz (NICEPERL)'s regular lists: Great modules released last week; MetaCPAN weekly report; StackOverflow Perl report.
entries.author: miguel_prz
entries.title: NICEPERL's lists
Dancer2 0.203001 improves speed of apps, fixes missing dependency
entries.author: jason_crome
entries.text: There's a new release of Dancer2.

entries.title: Simplest class builder "Object::Simple" 3.17 released!
entries.text: Kimoto-san has released a new version of his minimal class builder (think lightweight Moo), Object::Simple.
entries.author: yuki_kimoto

entries.title: The Math::BigRat Trap
entries.text: Martin (I don't know which Martin) points out the problem that might affect you if you upgrade Math::BigInt but don't upgrade Math::BigRat at the same time.

entries.title: The PSIXDISTS experiment
entries.author: matt_trout
entries.text: If you create a Perl6 directory in your CPAN author directory, anything you put there won't be considered for inclusion in the regular CPAN Index. Matt Trout explains.

entries.author: sawyer_x
entries.text: Sawyer's weekly round-up of the P5P mailing list.
entries.title: Perl 5 Porters Mailing List Summary: August 22nd-28th
CamelHarness.js version 0.2.1
entries.text: Dimitar announced CamelHarness, a library that can start Perl 5 scripts from applications based on Electron or NW.js.
entries.author: ddmitov
gabor_szabo
entries.text: Most Perl 5 testsuites start off by stating how many tests are expected to run; Gabor shows that you don't have to do this, and sometimes that's the easiest way to go.
entries.title: Forget your plan, just call done_testing

entries.author: ab5tract
entries.text: A new Perl 6 module, Terminal::Print, which aims to make it easier to do curses-like things in your scripts.
entries.title: Introducing Terminal::Print
Overkill III: Permutations of Overkill (Perl6)
entries.author: dave_jacoby
entries.text: Dave has been playing with Perl 6, using it to solve the Magic Box problem.

entries.author: karen_pauley
entries.text: Tony Cook's latest report on his work under a Perl 5 maintenance grant.
entries.title: Maintaining Perl 5: Grant Report for July 2016
Perl 6 Performance and Reliability Grant Progress Report
entries.author: karen_pauley
entries.text: The latest report on Jonathan Worthington's Perl 6 grant.

entries.title: Announcing Veure at The Perl Conference
entries.author: curtis_ovid_poe
entries.text: At YAPC::EU, Ovid officially announced the game that we've been hearing about as Veure. It has been launched as Tau Station.

entries.title: Audrey Tang appointed as minister without portfolio
entries.text: 2016-08-26 Audrey Tang has been given a position in the Taiwanese government, overseeing open data initiatives, and other things. She was previously a prolific Perl 5 developer, then led the first Perl 6 implementation in Haskell. Go Audrey!

entries.title: Technical documentation doesn't have to be dull
entries.author: ben_cotton
entries.text: A short post with thoughts on writing good documentation.

entries.title: 5 steps for making community decisions without consensus
entries.author: george_dunlap
entries.text: Large open source projects are collections of human beings, and human beings don't always agree with each other. Some thoughts on how to deal with that.

subject: Reports from YAPC::EU
header: There are a number of reports from YAPC::EU, and an aftermovie too.

Audrey Tang was first a Perl 5 programmer,
then she led the first Perl 6 implementation in Haskell,
and now she's a minister without portfolio in the Taiwanese government.
Congratulations to Audrey!
